about_the_game:
Albatroz is a backpacking adventure RPG that will take you through majestic landscapes in search of your lost sibling.

A tale about knowing when to let go and start over. Join Isla as she embarks on a journey through “The Forbidden Lands,” a breathtaking and otherworldly realm where two worlds converge.

Discover the mysterious disappearance of a family member

Isla, trapped in a numbing monotonous routine, is on a quest to discover the one true connection left in her life: her missing brother, who mysteriously disappeared while searching for the mythical Albatroz Mountain, known to the ancient inhabitants of these lands as "the walking mountain."

Experience a fantastical adventure with a captivating soundtrack

Albatroz immerses players in a thrilling fantasy expedition set in stunning landscapes, ranging from scorching coastal regions to freezing mountains, with secrets to unearth and strange occurrences beyond imagination. Adding to the enchanting experience is its beautiful and timeless music that sets the tone for the epic and magical adventure.

Explore diverse villages with intriguing residents

As you hike or drive through the wilderness, you will come across various villages in Albatroz. Players can visit these villages, meet their people, and learn about their culture. Villages are also excellent places to plan the next step in your journey, talking with NPCs who can give you clues of what lies ahead and even give you valuable items and special equipment.

Collect essential items and manage resources

Exploring these beautiful yet challenging landscapes in Albatroz can make you pass out if you lack the necessary supplies, so be sure to gather them whenever you get a chance. As you progress, these demanding environments will get increasingly more challenging, requiring you to employ thoughtful management of resources by considering the items you carry, using them efficiently and only when necessary, and stocking up new items before they run out.

Enhance your adventure skills

Every character in Albatroz possesses unique adventure skills. These skills are presented in their Skill Tree and can be upgraded from Tier 1 to Tier 3. As players navigate the world of Albatroz, uncovering new areas, interacting with objects, and assisting NPCs with their problems, they will accumulate Travel Points. These points can be used to unlock Tiers in the Skill Tree and level up your car, making the journey more manageable.

Features

  • Follow a deep narrative with captivating characters

  • Meet new friends and discover new cultures in a quest for self-discovery

  • Travel through beautiful and mysterious locations as you walk and drive through vast landscapes and face the wilderness

  • Manage resources, make travel plans, and improve your abilities in order to survive

content_descriptors.notes:
The game covers mature themes such as death, loss, mental disorders, family, and health issues. The atmosphere is often dark and mysterious with fog and eerie audio. Scary elements include witches stories, chaotic environments,
a giant monster and fear inducing scenes. There is veiled nudity where a female character's silhouette can be seen. The use of plants as medicine is mentioned.

Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10 or Higher
  • Processor: Intel(R) Core(TM) i5-4690K or AMD Ryzen 5 1600
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1070 or AMD Radeon Vega 56 Series or better
  • DirectX: Version 10
  • Storage: 45 GB available space

reviews:
“Unexpected gems from small studios with big ambition”
70 – IGN

“Among Giants' final result is impressive, given how skilfully they have managed to deliver such a daring, authentic and artistic project.”
82 – Meu PlayStation

“Albatroz is a relaxing game with a compelling story, beautiful visuals, and a vast world to explore. The soundtrack is excellent, creating a soothing atmosphere. While the game occasionally suffers from framerate issues, and the survival mechanics can feel more tedious than engaging, the overall experience is enjoyable.”
4/5 – Xboxhub
